excercise_preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull bar to upper waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension. A wide overhand grip involves overall back musculature while slightly emphasizing Rear Delt, Infraspinatus and Teres Minor involvement. Also known as Pendlay Row.

excercise_preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

excercise_preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

excercise_preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp cambered barbell below with overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull bar to upper waist or lower chest. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without barbell hitting floor.

excercise_preparation: Sit on incline and place feet on lower bar, or foot platform. Slide hips down by bending knees. Bend over and grasp cable attachment. Slide hips back, positioning knees with slight bend.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to waist while straightening back upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. See Cable Seated Row Question. Also see Cable Straight Back Incline Row and Dangerous Exercise Essay.

excercise_preparation: Sit on incline and place feet on lower bar, or foot platform. Slide hips down by bending knees. Bend over and grasp cable attachment. Slide hips back, positioning knees with slight bend. Straighten lower back so it is approximately perpendicular to incline.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight and perpendicular to incline, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Also see Cable Incline Row.

excercise_preparation: Place right knee on lower pad (positioned to right side) with foot of other leg slightly back out to side and knee slightly bent. Place right forearm on right side of upper pad and grasp handle. Grasp cable stirrup below with left hand. Allow left shoulder to be pulled forward without spinal rotation.
excercise_instructions: Pull stirrup up to side until elbow travels beyond surface of back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite side.
excercise_tips: Allow scapula to articulate, but do not rotate torso.

excercise_preparation: Straddle head of bench and grasp stirrups on two high pulley cables. Lie on bench with stirrups in each hand and arms extended upward.
excercise_instructions: Pull stirrups down to each side of chest until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched upward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Pulleys should not be too far apart, as they are on standard cable crossover machines. Stirrups on pulleys should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward when arms extend. Pull shoulder blades together when completing pull. Other rowing exercises should be considered if resistance required begins to exceed upper body weight since back will begin to raise up off of bench.

excercise_preparation: Grasp cable stirrup. Step back away from pulley, with foot on same side as exercising arm, positioned out to side well behind forward foot. Bend over with hand on nearby bar or above knee for support. Keep back straight and knees slightly bent. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, pulling shoulder back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: Supporting hand can also be placed on nearby bar, available on some pulley machines. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus stabilize near top of movement on forward leg.

excercise_preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench in order to grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Position hips back with knees slightly bent . Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, slightly twisting through waist. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If low back is kept still, Erector Spinae acts as synergist muscle. Also see Cable One Arm Twisting Seated Row.

excercise_preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench close to cable attachment. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Slide hips back by positioning knees with slight bend. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with forward bend and twist through waist.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side, extending and twisting through waist. Pull shoulders back and sit upright while pushing chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat and perform exercise with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: Also see Cable One Arm Seated Row.

excercise_name: Cable One Arm Seated High Row
excercise_preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench close to cable attachment. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Slide hips back by positioning knees with slight bend. Allow arm, shoulder, and torso to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, straightening back and leaning back slightly. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and torso is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If torso does not bend forward, Erector Spinae acts as stabilizer muscle. See straight back form. Quadratus Lumborum and Obliques are involved in spinal rotation if waist is rotated more than demonstrated. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus are no longer stabilizers if seated on bench with upper leg support.

excercise_name: Cable One Arm Straight Back Seated High Row
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat or bench. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Position torso upright allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: If two high pulleys are available, consider using opposite pulley as arm exercised. If pulley is far away enough, it is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. See Cable One Arm Seated High Row. Quadratus Lumborum and Obliques are involved in spinal rotation if waist rotates. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus become stabilizers, if seated on bench with feet propped forward with no upper leg support.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat or bench. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with twist through waist.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while twisting though waist in opposite direction. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: If two high pulleys are available use opposite pulley as exercised arm. If pulley is far enough away, it is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. See Cable One Arm Seated High Row. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus become stabilizers if seated on bench with feet propped forward with no upper leg support.

excercise_preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp cable attachment. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend. Allow weight on cable to pull torso forward while stretching arms and shoulders upward.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to waist and lean back slightly. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until torso, arms, and shoulders pulled forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If low back is kept still, Erector Spinae acts as synergist muscle. Also see exercise on bench and adjustable height pulley.

excercise_preparation: Sit and grasp cable stirrups one with each hand. Lean back slightly allowing arms, shoulders, and torso to be pulled forward under weight on cables.
excercise_instructions: Pull one cable stirrup to side. Pull shoulder back, push chest forward, and rotate body slightly toward pulling arm. Return until arm is extended and torso faces forward. Pull with opposite arm alternating between each side. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Rotation of torso as shown is optional. Quadratus Lumborum and Obliques act as stabilizers if waist is not rotated as demonstrated. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus act as stabilizers if seat is not available and legs are propped forward.

excercise_preparation: Sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp cable attachment. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to waist while straightening lower back. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. See exercise performed with Dual Pulley and related exercise Cable Straight Back Seated Row. Also see Cable Seated Row Question and Dangerous Exercise Essay.

excercise_preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench with feet on foot bar or vertical platform. Grasp close grip cable attachment. Straighten torso upright and slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Also see exercise performed on Dual Pulley and related exercise Cable Seated Row.

excercise_preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform in order to grasp cable attachment. With awider than shoulder width grip, slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to waist while pulling torso upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Begin with light weight and additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. See Cable Seated Row Question. Also see Cable Wide Grip Straight Back Seated Row and Dangerous Exercise Essay.

excercise_name: Cable Wide Grip Straight Back Seated Row
excercise_preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp cable bar attachment. With wider than shoulder width overhand grip, straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only slightly bent.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Also see Cable Wide Grip Seated Row.

excercise_preparation: Stand to side of medium height, rotating pulley. Place hand shoulder height or slightly lower on support bar with arm straight. Place foot nearest supporting arm forward with knee slightly bent and opposite foot back. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand, allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: Stirrup handle should be behind supporting bar. Few pulley units have vertical support bar (for supporting hand) far enough back from pulley to allow full range of motion and adequate pulley rotation to allow it to be aligned with line of pull. If pulley unit does not allow for this configuration, consider placing sturdy prop (for supporting hand) in front of pulley, far back enough to allow full range of motion. Also see Cable Standing Low Row.

excercise_preparation: Stand to side of low pulley. Place hand on support bar with arm straight. Place foot nearest supporting arm forward with knee slightly bent and opposite foot back. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand, allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: Also see Cable Standing Row with medium height pulley.

excercise_preparation: Stand facing high pulley positioned slightly above head level. Grasp stirrup with one hand and step back so arm is straight. With leg of opposite side as loaded arm, plant forefoot far back on floor. Slightly bend knee of forward leg, same direction as foot. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with twist through waist.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable attachment to side of torso and rotate body toward side of pulling arm. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: In standing position, both spinal rotation and hip rotation contribute to body's rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip internal rotation / transverse adduction) much greater than hip of rear leg since forward leg offers more secured base of support.

excercise_preparation: Kneel over side of bench by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side. Grasp dumbbell from floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull dumbbell to up to side until it makes contact with ribs or until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Torso should be close to horizontal. Positioning supporting knee and/or arm slightly forward or back will allow for proper levelling of torso. Torso may be positioned lower to allow for heavier dumbbell to make contact with floor, if desired.

excercise_preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
excercise_instructions: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond horizontal or height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor. Exercise can also be performed on Lying Row Apparatus or Incline Bench adjusted to height close to horizontal yet high enough to permit full range of motion at lowest range of motion.

excercise_preparation: Lie chest down on slightly inclined bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
excercise_instructions: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor. Lying on horizontal surface generally offers ideal angle of pull as long as bench is high enough to permit full range of motion at bottom most position.

excercise_preparation: With lever handles to sides, bend knees slightly and bend over with back straight. Grasp lower handles.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever handles up to sides. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Torso should be kept horizontal if flexibility allows. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, try bending knees more. Placing weight plates on higher bar lightens resistance at top where strength lessens, without compromising range of motion. See Gravity Vectors to understand how this positioning, altering direction of load, affects exercise resistance (resistance curve). Also see wide grip form.

excercise_preparation: Stand with toes under bar facing fulcrum. Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Exact stance from bar will depend upon height of fulcrum and length of lever. Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi, since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, grasp bar in standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension. A wide overhand grip involves overall back musculature while slightly emphasizing Rear Delt, Infraspinatus and Teres Minor involvement.

excercise_name: Lever One Arm Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Kneel over side of bench facing loaded side of lever bar by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side, straddling bar. Grasp bar from floor, several inches under barbell plates.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever bar up to side until bar contacts shoulder or just until elbow travels behind height of back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Lever base shown attaches to standard Olympic barbell. Improvising by placing barbell in corner may cause excessive wear on floor and floor board, or wall.

excercise_name: Lever Wide Grip Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: With lever handles to sides, bend knees slightly and bend over with back straight. Grasp wider handles.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever handles up to sides. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Torso should be kept as close to horizontal while allowing for full arm extension. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, try bending knees more. Placing weight plates on higher bar lightens resistance at top where strength lessens, without compromising range of motion. See Gravity Vectors to understand how this positioning, altering direction of load, affects exercise resistance throughout movement (resistance curve). Also see Lever Bent-over Row.

excercise_preparation: Lie chest on inclined platform and grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever up as high as possible. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Near top arch upper back and pull shoulders back as shown. To maximize back involvement, position body on pad or grip so wrists follow elbows. Some Incline Row apparatuses allow feet to be placed on floor, particularly if foot platform cannot be adjusted to accommodate height.

excercise_name: Lever Close Grip Incline Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Lie chest on inclined platform and grasp lever close grip handles.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever up as high as possible. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Near top arch upper back and pull shoulders back as shown. To maximize back involvement, position body on pad or grip so wrists follow elbows.

excercise_name: Lever One Arm Standing Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Place hand on support bar and grasp lever far forward. Place foot on side of moving arm on foot support and position opposite foot behind.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever to side while twisting torso toward opposite side. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and torso is pulled toward original direction. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: Unique apparatus designed and built by Tracey Cheuvront.

excercise_name: Lever Narrow Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

excercise_name: Lever Alternating Narrow Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
excercise_tips: None.

excercise_name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row (high bar, plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

excercise_name: Lever Alternating Wide Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
excercise_tips: None.

excercise_name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

excercise_name: Lever Seated Row (no chest pad, plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. Place feet on vertically angled platform. Slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
excercise_instructions: Pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to standard lever seated row machine. This exercise is more similar to Cable Seated Row. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. For even greater hip and low back articulation, hips may be slid back further with knees straighter. See Cable Seated Row Question and Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad).

excercise_name: Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad, plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat with feet positioned on foot bar or platform. Grasp handles with each hand. Position torso upright with knees bent slightly.
excercise_instructions: Pull handles to body. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to standard lever seated row machine. This exercise is more similar to Cable Straight Back Seated Row. Exercise may also be performed with greater low back involvement; see Lever Seated Row (no chest pad).

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand/neutral grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend. See exercise on alternative machine.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. Also see Cybex High Row.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend. Also see front view.

excercise_name: Lever Alternating Underhand Seated Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
excercise_tips: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

excercise_preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp lever handles with shoulder width to wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever up to torso. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Keep low back straight. Lighten load if torso raises beyond 45 degrees in order to complete repetition. See Gravity Vectors to understand how load would be decreased by positioning torso too high. Also see close grip form.

excercise_preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp lever handles with shoulder width to wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever up to torso. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Position torso as low as possible, allowing for full arm extension. Keep low back straight. Lighten load if torso raises beyond 45 degrees in order to complete repetition. See Gravity Vectors to understand how load would be decreased by positioning torso too high. Also see close grip form.

excercise_name: Lever Close Grip T-bar Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp parallel lever handles.
excercise_instructions: Pull handles up to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Closer grip increases lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension. Keep low back straight. Lighten load if torso raises beyond 45 degrees in order to complete repetition. See Gravity Vectors to understand how load would be decreased by positioning torso too high. Also see Lever T-Bar Row.

excercise_name: Lever Close Grip T-bar Row (plate loaded)
excercise_preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp parallel lever handles.
excercise_instructions: Pull handles up to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Closer grip increases lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension. Position torso as low as possible allowing for full arm extension. Keep low back straight. Lighten load if torso raises beyond 45 degrees in order to complete repetition. See Gravity Vectors to understand how load would be decreased by positioning torso too high. Also see Lever T-Bar Row.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. Also see Hammer Equipment Lever Seated High Row, Selectorized and Plate loaded versions.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull one lever handle back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
excercise_tips: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position thighs under pad. Lean forward and grasp lever handles above.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever down while leaning back slightly. As elbows travel to sides, lift chest slightly and pull shoulders and elbows back. Return until arms are extended and body and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Seat should be adjusted to allow for full range of motion. Also see Lever Seated Hammer High Row.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Push foot lever if available. Grasp narrower parallel grip handles.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp outer lever handles with overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. Place feet on vertically angled platform. Slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
excercise_instructions: Pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to standard lever seated row machine. This exercise is more similar to Cable Seated Row. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. For even greater hip and low back articulation, hips may be slid back further with knees straighter. See Cable Seated Row Question and Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad).

excercise_name: Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad)
excercise_preparation: Sit on seat with feet positioned on foot bar or platform. Grasp handles with each hand. Position torso upright with knees bent slightly.
excercise_instructions: Pull handles to body. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to standard lever seated row machine. This exercise is more similar to Cable Straight Back Seated Row. Exercise may also be performed with greater low back involvement; see Lever Seated Row (no chest pad).

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever handles back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull one lever handle back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
excercise_tips: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

excercise_preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
excercise_instructions: Pull bar to upper waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Platform (as shown) is only needed if smith machine does not allow bar to be lowered to lowest position. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility ). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either knees should be bent more or torso may not be positioned as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

excercise_preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Place back of heels on elevated surface.
excercise_instructions: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. Placing back of heels on elevated surface is optional. This exercise is typically performed without added resistance, although a weight vest can be worn or additional weight can be placed on belly or pelvis. Partner can add and remove weight, and keep weight from sliding off belly. Resistance can be further reduced by performing movement from higher bar and/or positioning heels on floor (see Inverted Row on high bar). See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of how body angle influences resistance. Also known as Weighted Body Row or Weighted Supine Row.

excercise_preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of body angle influences resistance. Also known as Body Row or Supine Row.

excercise_preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Place back of heels on elevated surface.
excercise_instructions: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. Placing back of heels on elevated surface is optional. This exercise is typically performed without added resistance, although additional weight can be placed on belly or pelvis. Partner can add and remove weight, and keep weight from sliding off belly. Resistance can be reduced by raising bar and positioning heels on floor. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of body angle influences resistance. Also known as Body Row or Supine Row.

excercise_preparation: Stand facing arms length away from waist to head height horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Position body under bar with legs, hips and spine straight. Arms should be straight, approximately perpendicular to body. Heels should make contact with floor.
excercise_instructions: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Bar height can be adjusted to vary resistance. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of how body angle influences resistance. Also known as Body Row or Supine Row.

excercise_preparation: Lay on back with belly under fixed horizontal bar. Bend knees and position feet on floor. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Keeping hips on floor and low back straight, pull torso up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of how body angle influences resistance. Also known as Body Row on Hips or Supine Row on Hips.

excercise_preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of how body angle influences resistance. Also known as Underhand Body Row or Underhand Supine Row.

excercise_preparation: Stand facing arms length away from waist to head height horizontal bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Position body under bar with legs, hips and spine straight. Arms should be straight, approximately perpendicular to body. Heels should make contact with floor with feet about perpendicular to legs.
excercise_instructions: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Bar height can be adjusted to vary resistance. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of body angle influences resistance. Also known as Underhand Body Row or Underhand Supine Row.

excercise_preparation: Position suspension handles higher than arms' length above floor. Sit on floor and grasp handles. Position body supine hanging from handles with arms straight, shoulders under handles, body straight, and back of heels on floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of body angle influences resistance.

excercise_preparation: Position suspension handles higher than arms' length above floor. Sit on floor and grasp handles. Hang shoulders under handles with arms straight, back and hips straight, with knees bent and feet flat on floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Handles should be positioned to allow for full arm extension, no lower. Instead of mounting from a seated or lying position, position can be assumed by stepping back with handles grasped in each hand until arms are straight forward. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back and under suspension handles. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright, minimizing contact with ground. See Gravity Vector for greater understanding of how body angle influences resistance. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Also known as Suspended Bent-knee Supine Row.

excercise_preparation: Grasp suspension handle(s) with one hand. Step back until handle is chest height when held to side of chest. Facing suspension apparatus with feet shoulder width apart, point other arm and its shoulder forward, parallel with angle of strap.
excercise_instructions: Rotate body and extended arm, reaching outward while lowering body downward by extending arm holding onto handle. Extend arms and shoulders in-line with suspension strap so body is angled back to one side. Return by raising body back upward in opposite motion, reaching outward and toward suspension strap while pulling handle back to side of chest until body is upright and arm parallel with angle of strap. Repeat and continue with opposite side.
excercise_tips: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Some suspension trainer brands allow independent use of only one handle, whereas, more popular brands require either anchoring unused handle within stirrup of gripped handle or grasping both handles with one hand.

excercise_preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle, hanging from handles with arms straight.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body and legs straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: At higher angles, feet can be placed flat on floor. When angled further back, only heels may contact floor with forefeet raising upward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. Kneel onto platform or step onto bar.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to stand on platform or bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Also see self-assisted technique without machine.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp parallel grips. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require standing on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp parallel grips. Step down onto assistance lever or platform.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to kneel on platform instead of standing on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to stand on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to stand on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Step down onto assistance lever or platform.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Some assisted machines require you to kneel on platform instead of standing on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent slightly.
excercise_instructions: With elbows bent slightly, lower bar over and beyond head until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.
excercise_tips: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Bent Arm Pullover.

excercise_preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent approximately 90°.
excercise_instructions: With elbow bent, lower bar over and just behind head until upper arm is approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.
excercise_tips: Keep elbows bent approximately 90° throughout exercise. Keep hips from raising up significantly. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Pullover.

excercise_preparation: Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Exercise can be performed with V-Bar or Multi-exercise Bar.

excercise_preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down one cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
excercise_tips: Stirrups are attached to split pulley.

excercise_preparation: Grasp stirrup in one hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.
excercise_tips: Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if spinal lateral flexion occurs during exercise.

excercise_preparation: Grasp stirrup in one hand and kneel on floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.
excercise_tips: Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if spinal lateral flexion occurs during exercise.

excercise_preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable attachments to sides of chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Stirrups are attached to split pulley.

excercise_preparation: Kneel on mat slightly away from high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. Sit with hips back and bend down by flexing hips so torso is bent over at approximately 30º angle. Allow resistance on cable pulley to pull arms upward with elbows bent.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable rope down until elbows are back and inside of rope attachment is behind neck. Return attachment over head until shoulder is completely flexed upward. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Keep hips and torso in same position throughout movement.

excercise_preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down one cable attachment to front side shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
excercise_tips: Stirrups are attached to split pulley.

excercise_preparation: Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Parallel Grip Cable Attachment is shorter than Pro Lat Bar, yet longer than Close Grip Cable Attachments.

excercise_preparation: Grasp pro lat bar with wide parallel grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable attachments to front sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Stirrups are attached to split pulley.

excercise_preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly, so hips are slightly lower than torso. Grasp revolving barbell cable attachment from behind. Pull to position cable attachment over chest. Fix elbows with small bend.
excercise_instructions: Lower cable attachment toward pulley with elbows bent only slightly. Lower until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are in-line with upper torso. Raise cable attachment over head and continue toward lower body until cable becomes very close to head. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise.

excercise_preparation: Face high pulley and grasp revolving cable attachment with arm slightly bent. Place one foot slightly back and bend over at hip until shoulder is fully flexed (upper arms at sides of head).
excercise_instructions: With elbows fixed approximately 30°, pull cable attachment down until upper arms are to sides. Return attachment overhead. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Fix elbows approximately 30° throughout exercise. Also known as Straight Arm Pulldown.

excercise_preparation: Sit on bench facing away from cable pulley apparatus. Grasp revolving cable attachment over head with overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: With elbows fixed with slight bend, pull cable attachment forward and down as far as possible. Return cable attachment forward and overhead. Repeat.
excercise_tips: If cable attachment is too high, grasp attachment first, then sit down. Fix elbows approximately 30° throughout exercise. Also known as Cable Seated Straight Arm Pulldown.

excercise_preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt chains. Step up and grasp bars with shoulder width underhand grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: If weight bottoms out at bottom, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

excercise_preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp close grip p arallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

excercise_preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp parallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: This particular apparatus could arguably be referred to as lever machine since dip belt attaches to lever arm, although relatively free movement between lever and dip belt offers qualities similar to cable machine. If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

excercise_preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: If weight bottoms out at bottom of motion, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull cable bar down behind neck. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. Position hands with underhand or neutral grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull down one cable attachment to front of shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat movement with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
excercise_tips: Video shows appartus with stirrups attached to dual pulley.

excercise_preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. Bend forward knee slightly. Position hands with underhand or neutral grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull down left cable attachment to front of shoulder. Pull right cable attachment down to front of other shoulder while returning left cable attachment to front of shoulder. Repeat movement with both arms in opposite pattern by pulling left cable attachment while returning right pully attachment. Continuing by alternating movement pattern between sides.
excercise_tips: Video shows appartus with stirrups attached to dual pulley.

excercise_preparation: Stand facing very high pulley. Grasp stirrup in one hand and step back so arm is straight. With leg of opposite side as loaded arm, plant forefoot far back on floor. Slightly bend knee of forward leg, same direction as foot.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest and rotate body toward side of pulling arm. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
excercise_tips: In standing position, both spinal rotation and hip rotation contribute to body's rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip internal rotation / transverse adduction) much greater than hip of rear leg since forward leg offers more secured base of support.

excercise_preparation: Grasp cable bar with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down cable bar to upper chest until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: None

excercise_preparation: Grasp handles and sit with thighs under padded supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down handles to sides of chest while leaning back slightly. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Erector Spinae can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.

excercise_preparation: Grasp lever bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down lever bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Grasp handles to each side with overhand grip. Sit on seat and position thighs under leg pads.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers down to sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: None

excercise_preparation: Adjust seat height so lever is near shoulder axis. Sit on machine. Place elbows on pads and grasp bar from behind.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever forward and down until elbows are to sides. Return until shoulders are fully flexed, or upper arms are parallel to torso. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility.

excercise_preparation: Grasp lever bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever bar down behind neck. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down lever handles toward sides until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: See pad kick down on Hammer Machine. Also see movement on alternative machine.

excercise_preparation: Grasp lever bar with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down lever handles toward sides until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Also see movement on Hammer Machine.

excercise_preparation: Grasp parallel lever bars. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down handles to sides of chest while leaning back slightly. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Erector Spinae can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.

excercise_preparation: Grasp parallel lever bars. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down handles to sides of chest while leaning back slightly. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Erector Spinae can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.

excercise_preparation: Grasp lever handles. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down lever to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: None

excercise_preparation: Stand on platform and grasp handles to sides with palms down grip.
excercise_instructions: With arms straight, pull lever handles down below hips. Return lever handles upward just above shoulder high, or just before slight pressure in shoulder is felt. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Platform should be adjusted so shoulder joint and girdle are approximate height as lever fulcrum. Also See Bent-over Fly on Iron Cross Machine.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat. Reach up and grasp handles with wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers down to sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. See Lever Pulldown performed on alternative apparatus. Also see exercise with parallel grip.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat. Reach up and grasp handles with overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers down to sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Also see Lever Pulldown performed on alternative apparatus.

excercise_preparation: Sit on seat. Reach up and grasp parallel handles.
excercise_instructions: Pull levers down to sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Also see Lever Pulldown.

excercise_preparation: Adjust seat height so lever is near shoulder axis. Sit on machine and push foot lever. Place elbows on pads and grasp bar from behind. Release foot lever and place feet on platform or to sides.
excercise_instructions: Pull lever forward and down until elbows are to sides. Return until shoulders are fully flexed, or upper arms are parallel to torso. Repeat.
excercise_tips: When finished, push foot lever before releasing arm from lever. Release foot lever after releasing arm from lever. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility.

excercise_preparation: Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down lever handles to sides until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: See pad kick down on Hammer Machine. Also see exercise on alternative machine.

excercise_preparation: Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down lever handles to upper chest until elbows are to sides. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Also see exercise on alternative machine.

excercise_preparation: Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
excercise_instructions: Pull down one lever handle to side until elbow is down to side. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate pulldown between arms.
excercise_tips: See pad kick down on Hammer Machine.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Also see Chin-up without added weight.

excercise_preparation: Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Also see Neutral Grip Chin-up without added weight.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp close grip parallel bars.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Also see Parallel Close Grip Pull-up without added weight.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles as shown. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Pull-up without added weight.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with neutral grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles.  Also see Neutral Grip Pull-up without added weight.

excercise_preparation: Reach up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Pull-up without added weight.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Added weight can be placed on dip belt (as shown) or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Also see Rear Pull-up without added weight.

excercise_preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip while keeping banded leg straight.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Free foot can be placed inside of band (as shown) or on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.

excercise_preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip while keeping banded leg straight.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Free foot can be placed to side of other foot (as shown) or on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.

excercise_preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip while keeping banded leg straight.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Free foot can be placed on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with neutral grip while keeping banded leg straight.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Special angled pull-up bar assembly is shown. Free foot can be placed on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot.

excercise_preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and place bent knee inside of band. Stretch band down further by pointing knee downward. Reach up and grasp bars to each side with wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp parallel bars while keeping banded leg straight.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Free foot can be placed inside of band (as shown) or on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.

excercise_preparation: Grasp middle of hanging exercise band and pull down to side of leg. Lift foot and hook band under heel. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Face perpendicular under pullup bar and position band behind body. Pull band apart and place other foot onto band so both feet are together inside of band. Reach up and grasp pull-up bar with overhand wide grip while keeping legs straight.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. At conclusion of set, step one foot out of band at bottom of exercises. Grasping each side of exercise band from behind and pull down. Transfer body weight onto free leg, bend knee of banded leg, release band from underfoot, and step out. Transfer both sides of taut band to one hand behind body. Turn body to side of hand holding band while permitting band to contract to normal length.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Easier

excercise_preparation: Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Easier

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp parallel bars.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Easier

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with neutral grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Special angled pull-up bar assembly is shown.

excercise_preparation: Reach up and grasp bars to each side with wide overhand grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until elbows are to sides or chin is just above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Also see self-assisted technique.

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
excercise_instructions: Pull body up until chin is just above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
excercise_tips: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Exercise can be used until Pull-ups can be performed. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide .

excercise_preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
